arm_group.description: T3 dental implant, with platform-switch  dental implant platform concept, measure marginal bone loss
T3 dental implant, platform-matched dental implant platform concept, measure marginal bone loss

brief_summary.textblock:
In patients that received a T3 (Biomet 3I) dental implant, does the use of platform-switch
      concept compared to the use of platform-matched concept, refrain marginal bone loss during
      osseointegration phase (t=12 weeks =T1) and from then to final rehabilitation (t= placement
      of the final restoration = at 18 weeks=T2)

clinical_study.brief_title: Compare the Success Rate of T3 Dental Implant (Biomet 3I) With or Without Platform-switch Concept

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients from a private practice who received dental implants (T3 dental implant Biomet 3I)
      from November 2012 to October 2013 were eligible to enter the study.

      Two groups were formed: one group received a T3 dental implant with platform switch concept
      and the other received an implant with platform matched type of connection.

      We evaluate osseointegration at T1 (12 weeks) and marginal bone position in relation to the
      implant platform at baseline (implant installation) T0 and again at T1 and T2.

      From data recorder in T0,T1 and T2, we evaluate changes in marginal bone position.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Single unit implant rehabilitation

          -  Maxilla and mandible

          -  Biomet 3I T3 dental implant placed

          -  Final Rehabilitation placed

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Immediate implants

          -  Radiographic impossibility of measure

          -  Absence of baseline T0 radiograph

          -  Smoking habits (more 10 cigarets a day)

          -  Diabetes

          -  Patients who receive Radio or/and Chemotherapy

study_pop.textblock:
Population from a private office who seek care to replace missing teeth, must have
        economical status to do implant supported rehabilitations

intervention.description: place dental implants according to manufacturer guidelines
Place Dental Implant with an abutment narrower than the implant platform
Place Dental Implant with abutment with same size as the platform

clinical_study.official_title: Marginal Bone Behavior of Dental Implants to Different Rehabilitation Protocols

oversight_info.authority: Portugal: Ethics Committee for Clinical Research

primary_outcome.description: Compare marginal bone position at baseline T0 (measured radiographically (digital) from the most coronal position of marginal bone to the most coronal position of the platform, measured in the most mesial and distal part (two measures) of the implant platform.
primary_outcome.measure: Position of Implant Platform to marginal bone

primary_outcome.description: Compare marginal bone position at T1, 12 weeks after baseline (T0) (measured radiographically (digital) from the most coronal position of marginal bone to the most coronal position of the platform, measured in the most mesial and distal part (two measures) of the implant platform

Compare marginal bone position at T2, 18 weeks from baseline (T0) (measured radiographically (digital) from the most coronal position of marginal bone to the most coronal position of the platform, measured in the most mesial and distal part (two measures) of the implant platform.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: measure the ability of the implant to integrate in bone

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
